DialogueOption.Text: I found an alien civilization hidden in our solar system!

Dialogue.Page: Woah.<Pause> WOAH.
You mean another one? Like one that wasn't the Nomai? Hidden RIGHT IN OUR SOLAR SYSTEM?!

DialogueOption.Text: I thought you were supposed to be an expert on these things.

Dialogue.Page: Oh. Cool. <Pause> That's... really cool. <size=20>Like, really really cool.</size>
NOT ABOUT AN ALIEN CIVILIZATION THAT NO ONE HAS EVER DISCOVERED BEFORE!

Okay. So you're saying that there was this whole other secret civilization that the Nomai didn't even know about? And that you discovered them all by yourself, just now, and basically came right back here to tell me about it?

DialogueOption.Text: Well, I'm in a time loop, so I didn't just come here.
Actually I talked to Hornfels first, but I thought that you should know.

Dialogue.Page: TIME LOOP?! WHAT TIME LOOP?! WHAT ARE YOU TALKING ABOUT?!

Oh great, so you find the most important discovery of our species since the Nomai, immediately go to Hornfels, come right on over to Brittle Hollow, and then tell me that you found an alien civilization that no one has ever discovered before?
Wow. Wow. Okay. Neat. That's fine. Yes.
Do you think that they might related to the Nomai somehow? And how could the Nomai have been here for so long and not have even known that they existed? Oh stars above, this is too much...

So, just to make sure that I'm getting this right. There are two different species that came before us in this system. One of them was (obviously) the Nomai, who lived here thousands of years ago if not more - and then you have this other, mystery civilization that's been here for... how long, exactly? And this is the first we're hearing about them?

DialogueOption.Text: Actually, three. You're forgetting about the Anglerfish, remember?
Not right now. I'm in a time loop, remember?

Dialogue.Page: Oh gosh, don't remind me. Just thinking about Dark Bramble makes my stomach churn.
SHUT UP ABOUT THE TIME LOOP! I don't even know what that means!
But what do you think they were doing here? And where would they have come from if they're not from our solar system?! I have so many questions.
But, um, wow. That's big. And I mean really big. Thanks, for telling me.
No! I mean, yes. I mean, not really. But I am! I promise! It's just... a lot, you know?

I come out here to learn more about the Nomai and then I learn that there's this whole other species out there that we know nothing about, and suddenly the part of me that wants to know more about the Nomai also wants to know more about THAT species, and then the other part of me who still wants to know about the Nomai doesn't want to know more about that species, because they know that I'll end up spending my time trying to learn about THAT species without learning anything about the Nomai! Does that make any sense?
Right?!
What do you mean what? I just said what! Weren't you listening?
NO I CAN'T LEARN ABOUT BOTH! THAT WOULD BE IMPOSSIBLE!

Anyway, it's cool that you found another species and everything, but right now I think I need to just relax, sit by this campfire, and try not to think about the fact that I could be thinking about a whole other species when I'm sitting here thinking about the Nomai. For now I think it's best that we just don't talk about it anymore. <size=20>For my sanity.</size>
